comments.body:
Did we think about how to more clearly mark the code in the sample that is specific to the sample (like, for instance, this Choice class), and the code that is generic and meant to be copy-pasted by the developer? I found myself scanning through this code, looking for the UI-specific part (the part about the AppBar, TabController, etc). I'm immediately presented with this "app state" code, so I'm left wondering "do I need this?"

Not sure how to do it, but I'd love to clearly mark/separate/draw-the-eye to the generic parts of this sample. The part I'm going to copy and paste.
here's a good example: is this required? Do I need to copy and paste this? I encounter this function, before it's used, so I don't have a lot of context.
